docs.snippet: A federal grand jury on Tuesday indicted a Kansas City man on three new charges for his alleged attempt last month to fire-bomb the local office of Missouri U.S. Democratic Representative Emanuel Cleaver, prosecutors said....

headline.main: Attempted Fire-Bombing of Missouri Federal Office Brings New Charges
headline.print_headline: Attempted Fire-Bombing of Missouri Federal Office Brings New Charges

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal grand jury on Tuesday indicted a Kansas City man on three new charges for his alleged attempt last month to fire-bomb the local office of Missouri U.S. Democratic Representative Emanuel Cleaver, prosecutors said.

docs.snippet: With the U.S. gay marriage battle looking increasingly like a lost cause for conservative opponents, a last battleground may be their quest to allow people to refuse services to gay men and women on religious grounds....

headline.main: Gay Marriage Opponents Pick New Battleground of Religious Freedom
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage Opponents Pick New Battleground of Religious Freedom

docs.lead_paragraph: With the U.S. gay marriage battle looking increasingly like a lost cause for conservative opponents, a last battleground may be their quest to allow people to refuse services to gay men and women on religious grounds.

docs.snippet: Conservative officials in some of the six states where Supreme Court action this week likely cleared the way for same-sex weddings say they won't issue marriage licenses to gay couples until their hands are forced. Now, gay rights advocates are pr...

headline.main: Conservative States Balk at Gay Marriage Action
headline.print_headline: Conservative States Balk at Gay Marriage Action

docs.lead_paragraph: Conservative officials in some of the six states where Supreme Court action this week likely cleared the way for same-sex weddings say they won't issue marriage licenses to gay couples until their hands are forced. Now, gay rights advocates are preparing to do just that.

docs.snippet: The last military president in Argentina's 1976-1983 dictatorship received another prison sentence on Tuesday, this time for the kidnapping and torture of 32 factory workers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The last military president in Argentina's 1976-1983 dictatorship received another prison sentence on Tuesday, this time for the kidnapping and torture of 32 factory workers.
